title: Note on Fourier inequalities
abstract:
We prove that the Hausdorff--Young inequality $\|{\widehat{f}}\|_{q(\cdot)}
\leq C \|{f}\|_{p(\cdot)}$ with $q(x)=p'(1/x)$ and $p(\cdot)$ even and
non-decreasing holds in variable Lebesgue spaces if and only if $p$ is a
constant. However, under the additional condition on monotonicity of $f$, we
obtain a full characterization of Pitt-type weighted Fourier inequalities in
the classical and variable Lebesgue setting.
